title-group.article-title: Optimal $L^{\infty}$ Estimates for the Finite Element Method on Irregular Meshes

abstract.p: Uniform estimates for the error in the finite element method are derived for a model problem on a general triangular mesh in two dimensions. These are optimal if the degree of the piecewise polynomials is greater than one. Similar estimates of the error are also derived in $L^p$. As an intermediate step, an $L^1$ estimate of the gradient of the error in the finite element approximation of the Green's function is proved that is optimal for all degrees.
